intro: Euodia vatiana, commonly known as the white-flowered euodia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It is often found in lowland tropical forests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
